Articles.Content:
Due to the excellent explanations posted by Ruregathon, i finally have started building a shuttle of my own.

the shape grew by itself and is not based on the WEKA. Yet it looks a bit similar, probably because i like the WEKA so much.

Here are some initial renderings of the Pook.

Edited September 1, 2013 by TheCardinal

Ouion, what are you trying to click?

TheCardinal, Looks cool, but the design looks like it won't play well with any other parts
It's interesting to say the least. Combination of wings and lifting body.It's going to be a bit tricky balancing out the CG/CF/CT, but it should fly the upper subsonic speeds fairly well.
Cool,beautyfull,compact,usefull,amazing...i like it so much,and i missed WEKA mini shuttle,please keep it up!!!

i remember the WEKA shuttle although i could never get the engine to work for some reason....

still this looks awesome but how big is it?

Are you using Blender? Your smooth shading is a bit much. You can use an edge split modifier to reduce the "putty" look a bit. Additionally, marking certain edges as "Sharp" will prevent them from being smoothed.
I'm using Wings3d. I know what you mean about the edge split modifier but this is the first thing i've ever designed using such a program. I'm taking it one step at a time.

Cool,beautyfull,compact,usefull,amazing...i like it so much,and i missed WEKA mini shuttle,please keep it up!!!

+1 I look forward to flying the Pook shuttle. I had some great flights with the WEKA and some real white-knuckle landings after intense re-entries. Used it as long as possible, until maybe half a year ago. Good luck on this project!

Yeah dude you seriously need some edge split on that.

Without edge split:

With:

Much better huh?

I also recommend switching to Blender. Once you understand the keyboard shortcuts it is really easy to churn out a decent model.
